thread.section_title: South Florida Sports News - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Bill Lazor says Ryan Tannehill makes more decisions than any QB he's coached
thread.title_full: Bill Lazor says Ryan Tannehill makes more decisions than any QB he's coached - Sun Sentinel

author: Omar Kelly
title: Bill Lazor says Ryan Tannehill makes more decisions than any QB he's coached
text:
There’s been discussion and debate about quarterback Ryan Tannehill’s control of the Dolphins’ offense, and whether he has permission to audible.
Speaking to reporters Thursday, offensive coordinator Bill Lazor wouldn’t clarify if Tannehill has a green light to change plays at the line of scrimmage, but he did stress that Tannehill makes more decisions than “any quarterback” he’s coached.
“He’s very intelligent,” Lazor said of Tannehill, who is completing 56 percent of his passes and has a 77.1 passer rating. “I’ve been in systems where the quarterback’s at the line making a lot of calls and it’s easy to turn on certain TV right now and see certain quarterbacks gesturing dummies, yelling all this stuff. I’ve been in systems where we did not audible at all. In the Jet game, Ryan changed the play by words. Some people would call that an audible, by hand signal.”
In a read-option offense, which the Dolphins utilize, the quarterback often has control of determining when the team is running or passing, and that decision is usually predicated on the opposition’s defense.
“He had plays where a run was called and without having to change anything, he decided to throw the ball,” Lazor said. “So if people don’t think he makes those decisions, then we’ve done a heck of a job with our disguises.”
Hyde: For all the changes they've made, can Dolphins let Ryan Tannehill audible? Dave Hyde In the midst of the ruinous Dolphins start, Ryan Tannehill's situation is particularly alarming. This was the year for him to take the last leap toward stardom. Instead, he's taken many steps backward In the midst of the ruinous Dolphins start, Ryan Tannehill's situation is particularly alarming. This was the year for him to take the last leap toward stardom. Instead, he's taken many steps backward (Dave Hyde) Injury updates
Defensive tackle A.J. Francis (back), who sat out two practices earlier this week, participated in Thursday’s session. ... Linebacker Chris McCain suffered a shoulder injury this week that limited his practice participation Thursday. ... Left tackle Branden Albert (hamstring) was a limited participant in practice for the second straight day, but he expects to play Sunday. ... Cornerbacks Brent Grimes (knee), Zack Bowman (shoulder) and defensive end Cameron Wake (hamstring) were also limited.
